experience: You and Mike both know John Furrier, Jeff Pulver, and 123 others

Ever wonder why attendance is dropping off at most major conferences?  I have the answer...it's because these shows could care less about giving partners great information that they can leave with and more importantly, implement!    This is why #nextcon17 is about our partners, plain and simple.  It's ALL about them.. period , end of story.  We love each and every one of them. #itsnotrocketscience #notyourmammasconference #nextivapartnersrock Nextiva
And why not finish up with a private concert for our partners with LEGENDARY Bret Michaels.   I left every ounce of energy at the conference.  All work and no play makes Ira a dull boy.  :)

summary: See http://mikemann.com/ -- Mike is founder and manager of Make Change! Trust, a charitable fund that supports select 501c3 organizations. See http://makechangetrust.org/Mike is also the founder of successful, active, for-profit corporations also including Phone.com, SEO.com, DomainMarket.com, Yield Software, and many others. In many cases his companies exchange resources, talent and technologies in their never-ending quest to deliver innovative, profitable digital products and services. In 1994 he founded Internet Interstate, sold to Verio Inc. in 1997. In 1998, he founded BuyDomains.com, the world’s largest secondary market for domain names, and sold majority interest to Highland Capital and Summit Partners in 2005, along with the “Seeq.com” search engine portal. See http://buydomains.com/Between 1998 and 2001, Mike served as the founding Chairman of the non-profit ByteBack.org, which is an innovator in operating free computer and job training centers serving inner-city communities.From 2006 to 2016 founder and chairman of Grassroots.org (501c3), a global network providing free services to non-profits and promoting social action. Mike is the author of Make Millions and Make Change! a book focused on making money in small business so we can better serve society. Please see http://www.makemillions.com/Contact: mikemann at mikemann dot comhttp://www.webstreetjournal.com/http://www.domainsuccess.com/gratitude/mike-mann-smart-branding-passion-charity/http://books.google.com/books?id=O2hEtUNVyTUC&q=mann#searchhttp://www.washingtonvc.com/wp-content/uploads/mike-mann-washington-business-journal.pdfhttp://blog.domaintools.com/tags/mike-mann/http://www.dnjournal.com/articles/gr.htmhttp://www.techcrunch.com/2007/11/15/the-return-of-phonecom-and-softwarecom/http://www.redherring.com/Home/23100http://www.seobook.com/archives/002331.shtmlSpecialties: Getting the job done one way or another.
